Services

Audience Configuration

Joy works with any combination of educators, to meet the identified goals of a school or district. Based on these goals, she can present to whole staffs, grade level groups, individual teachers, or a combination of audience configurations.

Strategic Planning

Working with leadership teams and administrators, Joy facilitates the identification of instructional and curricular targets. This results in a professional development plan that meets the current needs of both teachers and students.

Timing Options

Each school or district is unique in specific needs and concerns. There are a number of options available when considering the professional development when Joy works with educators. Due to the unfortunate trend in education to bring in too many initiatives, and different ones each year, teachers have the mentality of “this too shall pass”. Successful staff development is thoughtful, on-going, and consistent. (Transforming Professional Development into Student Results Reeves 2010,) An assessment the teacher needs and expertise determines the amount and duration of in-services or coaching.

Possible Options Include:

  • All staff training (one-time basis)
  • Facilitative training and coaching throughout the year to develop long-term success and efficacy

I highly recommend Joy Wenke as a trainer! She is a dynamic presenter, and her years of school experience, especially with English Learners, make her a valuable resource to teachers and administrators alike. Joy is providing our professional development district-wide. She works collaboratively with me to design the course that best meets the particular needs of my district (not a “canned” presentation). The teachers thank me for bringing Joy to our district!

Lonna Martinez
Director, Educational Services, Hollister School District

Teacher trainings are customized to the times available for professional development and the audience. The descriptions are a reference point for discussing your school’s instructional and curricular needs and can be altered to better meet your goals.

English Language Learners
  • Effective instructional tools for English Language Learners: maximize your ELD time with purposeful language objectives aligned to ELD and Common Core standards and high student engagement strategies
  • Understanding the California English Language Development Test (CELDT)
Thinking Maps® Developing a Common Language for Critical Thinking
  • Engaging instructional tools that teach students how to think
  • Effectively teach the Common Core through the lens of Thinking Maps®
Facilitate successful and productive professional learning communities
  • Work effectively and efficiently as teams planning lessons and units with the Common Core Standards
Teacher coaching and model lessons
  • Objective: 100% student engagement, critical thinking, checking for understanding, formative assessments
Building a preventive and proactive literacy plan
  • The Five BIG researched based ideas of Literacy: teaching what is important
  • Early literacy training
  • DIBELS Trainer (Dynamic Indicators of Basic Early Literacy Skills)
